solution_line_template: The square of the base of the first triangle is {base}*{base}=<<{base}*{base}={base_squared}>>{base_squared} square inches
The square of the height of the first triangle is {height}*{height}=<<{height}*{height}={height_squared}>>{height_squared} square inches.
The sum of the squares of the base and the height of the first triangle is {base_squared}+{height_squared}=<<{base_squared}+{height_squared}={sum_of_squares}>>{sum_of_squares}

The square root of the sum of the base and the height of the first triangle, which is the hypotenuse of the triangle, is 
25={hypotenuse} inches.

Since the perimeter of a triangle is found by adding the sides of the triangle, the base and height of the triangle sum up to {height}+{base}=<<{height}+{base}={base_plus_height}>>{base_plus_height} inches
If you add the hypotenuse of the triangle the perimeter of the triangle becomes {base_plus_height}+{hypotenuse}=<<{base_plus_height}+{hypotenuse}={perimeter}>>{perimeter} inches.
